questionListItems.title: I am a foreigner and do not have a SingPass. How do I register for the OBS course?

answer.body: Please approach your child’s teacher for assistance to enrol your child.

questionListItems.title: If the student is sick before OBS and absent from the Course, will the student be arranged to attend the next MOE-OBS Challenge Programme?

answer.body: Schools are allocated course dates with consideration for overall capacity. If students missed their allocated week, he/she will not be able to attend the next course.

questionListItems.title: Will students with special needs be able to attend the Course?

answer.body:
We recognise there is a varying degree of special needs. OBS reviews our enrolment policies, capabilities, and resources regularly with MOE to support students with special needs to participate in the course independently.

 

In some instances, OBS may require the presence of the school staff (e.g., AED LBS or teacher) as a condition for enrolment. This is to ensure the student is well-supported throughout his/her participation in the Course. In such cases, the school’s support is crucial for the enrolment of the student.

questionListItems.title: Is there a specific type of doctor who is qualified to conduct the medical examination for the MOE-OBS Challenge Programme?

answer.body:
MOE has arranged for contracted medical service providers for the medical certification. Alternatively, any General Practitioner (GP) is qualified to assess the current health status of the student for the purposes of the course.


However, students with pre-existing conditions are advised to go back to their attending family doctor or specialist as the attending doctor would be most familiar with the student’s medical history.


Do note that many polyclinics do not provide medical examination for course participation. Please check with the polyclinic before making an appointment.

questionListItems.title: Are all students required to go for a medical examination as part of the registration process?

answer.body: Students participating in the MOE-OBS Challenge Programme will be required to go for a medical examination to be certified fit for participation by a medical doctor.

questionListItems.title: Can my child pack and consume his/her vitamins or supplements for the course?

answer.body: Yes, your child can pack his/her usual vitamins or supplements. Do inform your child’s school of the supplements or declare it in the Course Registration Form. Your child will need to inform and show the vitamins or supplements to the Instructors on Day 1 in OBS.

questionListItems.title: Does my child need to bring a sleeping bag?

answer.body: As part of the course, students will be sleeping in tents for all the nights. The sleeping bag is an optional item in the packing list as it may get quite humid in the tent at night and is not compulsory for students to bring it. However, if you child wish to bring a sleeping bag for added comfort for the night, do ensure that it is sealed in a waterproof liner/plastic bag so it can remain dry.

questionListItems.title: What should my child bring for the course?

answer.body: Please refer your child to the packing list (www.go.gov.sg/5dmocpackinglist). There is no need for expensive, technical gear. If your child is missing some items, we encourage him/her to borrow from family/friends/schoolmates to minimise unnecessary expenses. OBS discourages students from bringing along expensive items. Your child’s valuables such as mobile phone and wallet will be safekept by OBS to ensure security of personal items and minimal distraction during the course.

questionListItems.title: What physical preparation does my child need to do for the course?

answer.body: Before coming to the course, your child is encouraged to engage in light exercises. Your child should have sufficient sleep the night before the course and have hearty breakfast before reporting to school.

questionListItems.title: Can my child be given some time to leave OBS on Friday to go to the mosque for Friday Prayers, and return to OBS thereafter?

answer.body: Typically, students will be dismissed on Friday afternoon, so they may not have enough time to leave OBS to go to the mosque for Friday Prayers and return to OBS thereafter.

questionListItems.title: Can my child be excused from doing water activities if their school is attending during the ghost festival month?

answer.body: Students are not allowed to choose their preferred type of activities to participate in. The OBS course is designed such that despite the different types of activities, students can achieve almost the same learning outcomes.

questionListItems.title: Can I request for my child to be allocated to a mainland group during the ghost festival month?

answer.body: Students are randomly allocated into groups across all OBS campuses in mainland and Pulau Ubin. Students are not allowed to choose campus or type of activities to participate in. The grouping of students is planned with the objective of a well-mixed group of schools to achieve the learning objective of social cohesion.

questionListItems.title: For the Muslim students, will they be allowed to perform their prayers?

answer.body: Students can pray when course schedule permits. This is because OBS course involve expeditions that start from morning and lasts throughout the day. The expeditions are conducted in terrains such as coastal area in the sea and forested area. The key priority is for the instructor to be able to account for the safety and learning of the whole group.

questionListItems.title: Can my child bring his/her personal prayer necessities (e.g., prayer mat, prayer garment) and is it practicable to deploy the prayer mat and change into the prayer garment in some of the settings?

answer.body: Yes, bringing their prayer necessities is allowed. They can don their prayer garment and use their prayer mat where practicable.

questionListItems.title: Will there be facilities for my child to wash up before prayer?

answer.body: There will be access to water to perform ablution at the OBS campuses.
